text: George Stephenson (9 June 1781 12 August 1848) was an English civil engineer and mechanical engineer. He built the first public railway line in the world to use steam locomotives. He is known as the "Father of Railways". George was born in Wylam, which is in Northumberland. Stephenson's rail gauge of 4 feet 8Â½ inches (1,435 mm),Rail guage is the standard distance between the two rails. sometimes called the "Stephenson gauge", is the standard gauge for most of the world's railways.
